tasks.description: Three guardrails to prevent lazy consensus in deliberations: (1) Coverage gate -- track numbered sub-questions from the framing, verify each gets substantive treatment before synthesis. (3) Randomize or rotate agent speaking order per round so no single agent always anchors the frame. Implementation: these are behavioral rules for Claude as mediator, but could also be encoded as a pre-synthesis checklist in the deliberation flow.

tasks.title: App loading screen or faster startup
tasks.description: The app shows a blank white screen while loading, making it impossible to tell if it's broken or just slow. Either: (1) reduce load times so the white screen is negligible, or (2) add a loading/splash screen with the Hello World branding so the user knows the app is starting up and not stuck. Investigate what's causing the slow load -- could be heavy JS bundle, synchronous state reads, or Rust init. A Tauri splash screen (native window) or an inline HTML loading indicator in index.html (before React mounts) are both viable approaches.

tasks.title: Design and implement subagent team strategy
tasks.description: Design a comprehensive team strategy where specialized subagent teams work together on different aspects of the Hello World project. Teams: Red Team (security, exploit finding, adversarial testing), Dev Team (feature implementation, code quality), UX Team (user personas of varying skill levels), Strategy Team (tech CEO perspectives, product direction), Security Team (audit, hardening), QA Team (testing, edge cases). Each team needs: defined roles, coordination patterns, when to spawn, how results feed back. Pat wants liberal agent usage -- no token conservation.

tasks.title: Crash-safety sentinel: buddy-spawned hidden process that survives crashes
tasks.description: Redesign the watcher system as a persistent crash-safety sentinel. Buddy spawns a hidden Node.js process (windowsHide: true) on startup that polls the Tauri PID. On app death (crash or clean exit), sentinel runs recovery: backup state files, write crash-marker.json, preserve activity log. Buddy shows a shield indicator (lit=polling, dark=inactive). If sentinel dies, buddy respawns it. Replaces the per-task app_shutdown_copy pattern. Needs: (1) Rust command in lib.rs to spawn hidden process and report app PID, (2) sentinel.mjs script that polls and runs recovery, (3) BuddyOverlay shield indicator with health check, (4) SessionStart hook reads crash-marker.json on next boot.

tasks.title: Fix clean shutdown: write endedAt to sessions.json on window close
tasks.description: The sentinel always thinks window-close is a crash because no code writes endedAt to sessions.json before the process exits. Fix: intercept CloseRequested in Rust, read sessions.json, stamp endedAt on the latest session, write back. Then sentinel correctly distinguishes crash vs clean exit.
